name: Big Data Developers in London
description:
This is an IBM sponsored Big Data meetup group. Geared towards developers, data scientists and ALL Big Data enthusiasts. Our Meetups typically include two or three 30-45 min presentations that serve as an introduction and overview for a specific Big Data technology. It is followed by ~2 hours to collaborate and network with fellow developers. Our meetups are FREE. Meetup topics include: - Hadoop-based analytics - Stream (Real-time) Computing - Spark - Text Analytics - Visualisation and Discovery tools for Big Data - Big Data App Development - Predictive Analytics - Machine Learning - Cognitive analysis techniques - Deep dives into the technologies that makes big data processing possible - Anything and everything about Big Data. Join us today.


The Message Boards are only for use for discussion of MeetUps.  Do not use to post jobs or marketing information.  You will be banned!

name: Open Source Analytics - Boston
description: Community of technical and business analytics experts dedicated to the latest breakthrough technologies in open source analytics. We invite speakers to discuss emerging trends and innovations in Big Data - Hadoop and Spark, machine learning, data mining, data visualization and cognitive analytics. Join us to find out the latest new ideas and meet other experts in open source analytics.

organizer.name: Nick D
organizer.bio: Currently - worldwide leader for IBM's Open Source Analytics Program Office. Focused on Big Data analytics - Hadoop and Spark. Previously worked for Oracle and various tech start-ups. World traveler, performance sailing enthusiast, extreme skier.

name: All India Oracle Users Group - Chennai Chapter
description:
What is AIOUG?

AIOUG is a non profit organization started by like minded users who think such a community is required in India where the amount of Oracle user base is humongous. The idea of this group is to share what the Oracle users have learned from using Oracle technology over the years with fellow users who have similar interest. - See more at: http://www.aioug.org/#sthash.go59whyW.dpuf

AIOUG Chennai Chapter is the local chapter of AIOUG. 

Website : http://www.aioug.org/

Facebook Page : https://www.facebook.com/AIOUG.Chennai.Chapter/?fref=ts

name: Seattle Streams
description: Have you ever wondered how Netflix delivers movies to your home with a flick of a tile? or how Twitter keeps your tweets flowing to deliver you breaking news? or how Tesla knows when to notify its drivers when to service their electric vehicle? If so, join us in this exciting new meetup to uncover the mysteries of continuous data flows and how to build robust stream computing environments. We're looking for speakers, enthusiasts, hackers, and innocent bystanders to join us for food and drink in and around your area.

name: CouchDB and Cloud Data Services Meetup - Austin
description: We're a community of developers, technologists, and business leaders who view data as one of the most powerful natural resources of the 21st century and are seeking ways to gain greater insights from it. This group will discuss cloud-based technologies, including CouchDB and an array of Cloud Data Services provided by IBM (including Cloudant NoSQL JSON DBaaS, analytic engines such as dashDB and BigInsights, and other services The focus of this group is to dig into these technologies at a developer level as well as discuss the innovations these services are enabling across a diverse set of industries.

- Deep dives into the technologies that makes big data processing possible

- Anything and everything about Big Data

Join us today for a hands on software development experience.

name: Apache Spark in Moscow
description:
This is a meetup for users of Spark (http://spark.apache.org), the high-speed cluster programming framework. We will discuss Spark-related projects, including Spark SQL, MLlib, GraphX, Scala and Spark Streaming. The meetup includes introductions to the various Spark features, case studies from users, best practices for deployment and tuning, and updates on development. 

Join us to learn more about how Spark can change your environment and development time.

name: Big Data Developers in Madrid
description:
Hola!!

Este es un grupo de Meetup de Big Data esponsorizado por IBM, dirigido a científicos de datos, ingenieros, desarrolladores y todos los entusiastas del Big Data o que quieren aprender sobre estas interesantes materias. Además proporciona un marco muy bueno para conocer a otras personas interesadas en estas tecnologías, compartir experiencias (networking) y pasar momentos agradables.

Hacemos 2 tipos de meetups:

1) Unos que son por la mañana que normalmente contienen  presentaciones y demos técnicas y después un laboratorio para practicar lo que se ha contado (la duración suele ser toda la mañana).

2) Otros que suelen ser por la tarde (después del trabajo) , en los que hay presentaciones y demos técnicas pero no suelen tener laboratorios prácticos. Estos suelen ser más cortos (ej. de 18:00 a 20:00).

Nota: En cualquier caso la agenda con las horas se detallan cada vez.

Además de buenas charlas técnicas, una parte esencial de nuestros Meetups son las pizzas y las cervezas (espero que nunca fallen!).

Procuramos que las presentaciones aunque técnicas cualquiera las pueda seguir aunque no tenga un conocimiento de la materia en cuestión.

Nuestros meetups son gratuitos.

Nuestros meetups incluyen tecnologías como:

- Hadoop/Spark.

- Stream Computing.

- Big SQL.

- Text Analytics.

- Machine Learning.

- Desarrollos de aplicaciones Big Data.

- En general cualquier tema relacionado con la tecnología de Big Data.

Espero que os gusten!

Un abrazo

Luis Reina

Our Meetups typically include a 45-60 min (max) presentation that serves as an introduction and overview for a specific Big Data technology. It is followed by ~3 hours to collaborate with fellow developers and apply your Big Data skills. We provide a cloud environment that you can run through the browser of your laptop at NO cost to you. Our meetups are FREE.

Meetup topics include:

- Hadoop-based analytics
- Stream Computing
- Text Analytics
- Visualization and Discovery tools for Big Data
- Big Data App Development
- Deep dives into the technologies that makes big data processing possible
- Anything and everything about Big Data

Join us today for a hands on software development experience.

description: Have you ever wondered how Netflix delivers movies to your home with a flick of a tile? or how Twitter keeps your tweets flowing to deliver you breaking news? or how Tesla knows when to notify its drivers when to service their electric vehicle? We're looking for speakers, enthusiasts, hackers, and innocent bystanders to join us for food and drink in and around your area.

name: IBM Developer Community - Indonesia
description:
This group is for all Beginners, Developers, Subject Matter Experts, IT Consultants and Researchers who are excited and enthusiasts about learning and developing applications on IBM® Bluemix™ cloud. 

Embrace the opportunity to enable yourself with knowledge to develop applications in bluemix and get ready for the future. You will get an opportunity to meet with product architects from IBM, experts, fellow developers and like minded people. 

Join us today to learn Bluemix, deep dive into it and start converting your ideas to develop innovative applications easily. Our meetups are free!

To get started with Bluemix - Sign Up for a free Bluemix trial and start building your application. 

What is IBM Bluemix? 
IBM® Bluemix™ is an open-standards, cloud-based platform for building, managing, and running apps of all types, such as web, mobile, big data, and smart devices. Capabilities include Java, mobile back-end development, and application monitoring, as well as features from ecosystem partners and open source - all provided as-a-service in the cloud. 
Bluemix is built on the Cloud Foundry open source technology that provides mobile and web developers access to IBM software for integration, security, transaction, and other key functions, as well as software from business partners. Bluemix offers more control to application developers by using its Platform as a Service (PaaS) offering, and also provides pre-built Mobile Backend as a Service (MBaaS) capabilities. The goal is to simplify the delivery of an application by providing services that are ready for immediate use and hosting capabilities to enable internal scale development. 
With the broad set of services and runtimes in Bluemix, the developer gains control and flexibility, and has access to various data options, from predictive analytics to big data.

References:

Wake up to Cloud and Bluemix!
